subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate checks the inventory management system to determine if the out-of-stock product is eligible for backorder and to ascertain the estimated delivery timeframe.
success_criteria: Backorder eligibility is determined via inventory system
Estimated delivery timeframe is retrieved from the system

subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate informs the customer about the backorder option, clearly communicating the estimated delivery timeframe and any associated terms and conditions.
success_criteria: Customer is informed about backorder option and estimated delivery timeframe

subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate obtains the customer's consent to place the product on backorder, ensuring they understand the delivery timeframe and agree to wait for the product.
success_criteria: Customer provides explicit consent to place the order on backorder

subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate places the backorder in the POS system or inventory management system, accurately recording the customer's details, product information, and agreed-upon delivery timeframe.
success_criteria: Backorder is accurately placed in the system with all required information

subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate provides the customer with an order confirmation, including the backorder number, product details, estimated delivery timeframe, and contact information for order inquiries.
success_criteria: Customer receives a clear and complete order confirmation

subprocess_flow.description: The sales associate schedules a follow-up communication with the customer to provide updates on the order status, particularly if there are any changes to the estimated delivery timeframe.
success_criteria: A follow-up communication is scheduled to provide order status updates
